definition: to keep as a souvenir/to recall fondly
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])

sentences.english: Many students go through the gate and take a photo with it.
sentences.chinese: 很多學生從“永不掛科門”中穿過，或合影留念。

sentences.english: This was the last arch stone bridge. We took a photo of team here.
sentences.chinese: 上山前最後一座石拱橋，在這裏，我們集體合影留念。

sentences.english: Fu Kecheng, chairperson of Jiangxi Political Consultative Conference and Board chairman Zheng Yuanbao.
sentences.chinese: 江西省政協主席傅克誠與鄭元豹董事長合影留念。

sentences.english: Posted on a street-side photography stall are several souvenir photographs of Africans.
sentences.chinese: 一個街頭照相攤上上貼着幾張非洲人的留念照。

sentences.english: At the end of the meeting, Wen took photos with each of the members.
sentences.chinese: 會見結束後，溫家寶分別同每個醫療隊員合影留念。

sentences.english: In order to commemorate the day, they nicknamed it Singles Day.
sentences.chinese: 爲了留念這一天，他們給它命名爲“王老五騙子節”。

sentences.english: thank you for one of the most memorable days of my trip.
sentences.chinese: 爲了旅途中最值當留念的一天，謹向您暗示感激。

sentences.english: The attendees mingled, exchanged calling cards and traded cameras for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 與會者交雜著，互相交換名片與相互拍照留念。

sentences.english: Ly Pao holds one of the group's children.
sentences.chinese: 鮑立抱着營寨中的一個孩子合影留念。

sentences.english: The film fans gathered around him and asked for his autographs.
sentences.chinese: 影迷圍上來要他簽名留念。

sentences.english: Very not easy walk to macau Paul's cathedral, must remember to take pictures souvenir.
sentences.chinese: 好不容易走到澳門大三巴牌坊，一定要記得拍照留念。

sentences.english: Wang Wenyuan, vice-chairperson of the CPPCC ninth National Committee, and Board Chairman Zheng Yuanbao.
sentences.chinese: 九屆全國政協副主席王文元與董事長合影留念。

sentences.english: Wang Xiangkun, Deputy Mayor of Shengyang City, and Board Chairman Zheng Yuanbao.
sentences.chinese: 瀋陽市副市長王翔坤與鄭元豹董事長合影留念。

sentences.english: Sale of each piece of work can be posed for pictures with Maqing Fu teacher.
sentences.chinese: 出售每幅作品均可與馬慶福老師合影留念。

sentences.english: Hegang "Shenzhou VI" male members of the team posed for pictures in the young Square.
sentences.chinese: 鶴崗“神六”車隊男隊員在知青廣場合影留念。

sentences.english: After taking pictures with the fish, Sheila put it back to the river.
sentences.chinese: 在與這條鮎魚拍照留念後，希拉將這條鮎魚放回河中。

definition: to take a photo as a souvenir/a souvenir photo
to take a joint photo/group photo
reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
reluctant to part with (sth or sb)/unwilling to let go of
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
to cherish the memory of/to think of/reminisce
